column4: does anyone know if there is discussion/project on getting x to autoconfigure for the monitor plugged into the system?  i know that perhaps one can use a yast like dialog that lets the user choose either the model/make or generic settings, just wondering if there is anything active going on this topic
mine is autoconfiguring the monitor :)

how? can you take your hd to any machine, plug it in and it will adjust the refresh rates and available resos for the model/make? or are you just saying you have some basic generic settings with resolution no greater than 1024x768?
no. i'm saying i don't have to add the refresh rates of the monitor, since i'm using DDCMode that fetches that automatically
really? what is ddcmode? i've not heard of this, sounds like the solution :)
I added option "DDCMode" "on" to my xorg.conf, and voila
from the monitor I think, if it supports it (but i'm not sure). the option should be added under the "device" section (i have an ATI card if that matters)
good enough, i'll google the rest of the info, my thanks!
are they more rabid there than #debian?
i spoke with the guys in the gnome channels and appearently esd is deprecated
has quit ("how nice, a nazi pope")  <-- rofl
haha
did you, or did you not take your tranquilizers today? ;)
:) lol
he's dualbooting ;)
hes using a network share to access the files on the same machine?
no? he's mounting a fat32 partition
if this is what you do for fun, you need help bro :)
well, why are YOU sitting here?
i have a cat5 in my cell
ahah, that explains a lot
